> [xcape2net](#comment_294_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Iran is the only one I'm sure of.  You could argue about Iraq and Libya.  Foreignpolicy.com says Chile.   If I'm not mistaken, the US also created democracies in Congo, Guatemala, and Brazil.  But it's hard to say, since the history books are written by the winners of wars.  Also, there are no pure democracies anywhere in the world.  So, on that basis, you could argue that the US has never overthrown a democracy.

If they did indeed overthrew the communist government in Chile, then Thank You.
